title: Smart meter data firm SMAP Energy snapped up by ENECHANGE
lead: ​SMAP Energy is to be acquired by Japanese firm ENECHANGE as the two aim to build a +$1 billion energy tech company.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Mapping and monitoring decentralised grids: the challenges facing utilities
lead: Geospatial software company IQGeo's regional manager Richard Weiss takes a look at the impact of legacy maps on the transition to decentralised grids.
author: Richard Weiss

title: WPD targets net zero by 2028 in new draft of RIIO-ED2 plan
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) is pledging to become net zero by 2028, reiterating its plans to invest £6 billion in network transformation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Labour calls for 'electric vehicle revolution' as it unveils new proposals
lead: ​Shadow energy secretary Ed Miliband has called for an “electric vehicle revolution” in every part of the country in an effort to boost jobs and support decarbonisation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Scottish Renewables report warns 'UK will fail to meet' climate change targets without long duration storage
lead: ​Scottish Renewables has warned that the UK’s climate change targets will not be met without the removal of barriers to long duration storage such as pumped storage hydro.
author: Alice Grundy

title: VEST Energy announces battery trading agreement with IBNE
lead: ​Cleantech trading house VEST Energy has signed a long term battery trading and offtake arrangement with Infra Balance New Energy (IBNE).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: E.ON hails turnaround in UK retail business with £100m earnings jump
lead: ​E.ON has managed to turnaround its operations in the UK and is expected to recover faster than originally anticipated, it said in its full year results for 2020.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN launches digital portal to improve clean tech connection process
lead: ​UK Power Networks has launched a new digital portal to help installers connect clean technologies to homes and businesses.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Hitachi Capital UK unveils US$40m green bond
lead: ​Hitachi Capital UK has announced a new US$40 million (£29 million) green bond in support of its clean transport and renewables ambitions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO joins the ENA to ‘accelerate progress’ towards net zero
lead: ​National Grid Electricity System Operator (ESO) has become an official member of the Energy Networks Association (ENA).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: NewMotion passes 200,000 chargepoint milestone
lead: Access to 200,000 electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints is now on offer across through NewMotion's network 35 European countries in a new milestone.
author: Alice Grundy

title: House of Lords sub-committee weighs in on post-Brexit electricity trading
lead: ​The House of Lords EU Environment sub-committee has released a new report, in part detailing its views on electricity pricing and trading post-Brexit.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF’s West Burton A to close in 2022 leaving just one remaining coal power station
lead: ​EDF is to shutter its West Burton A power station in September 2022, leaving just one coal-fired power station remaining in the UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ElectraLink completes Distribution Connection and Use of System Agreement digitalisation
lead: ​ElectraLink has finished its digitalisation of the Distribution Connection and Use of System Agreement (DCUSA), improving accessibility and navigation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: WPD claims industry first with launch of new data portal
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) has launched its Beta Connected Data Portal, offering access to a range of data  on energy consumption, generation, network loads and more.
author: Alice Grundy

title: GRIDSERVE ‘moving heaven and earth’ in Electric Highway replacement works
lead: ​GRIDSERVE is “working at a pretty phenomenal pace” to replace the existing electric vehicle (EV) chargers on Ecotricity’s Electric Highway.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Gemserv calls for electricity market governance reform to ‘unleash’ decarbonisation
lead: Professional services firm Gemserv has called on the government to reform governance of the UK energy market to enable the energy transition.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Environmental Audit Committee says domestic decarbonisation support has been ‘woefully inadequate’
lead: ​The Environmental Audit Committee (EAC) has lent its weight to calls for the Green Homes Grant to be rolled over beyond the end of March 2021.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: OVO launches OVO Drive division to help 'lead the way' in the EV market
lead: ​OVO Energy is to expand its current electric vehicle (EV) offering as it launches OVO Drive, with Tonik Energy co-founder Chris Russell to helm the division.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Chats: Limejump’s Catherine Newman on the ODFM, DC and maintaining ‘agility’
lead: Almost a year since she took over the reins, Current± caught up with Limejump’s chief executive Catherine Newman to discuss capitalising on the changing market, Dynamic Containment and working as a scale-up.
author: Molly Lempriere
